title: Slab Serif Similar to SOHO
content:
I realize this is a new font, but I was wondering if there was anything out there that is similar to it. The closest I could find was [Quint](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014010915/http:/www.paratype.com/ustore/fonts/URW-Quint.htm)

 [‹ Question: according to you, what's the best font for books' body?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014010915/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38487 "Go to previous forum topic") [20$ to the person who help med design a logotype! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014010915/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38684 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Capnhud

comments.content:
I recently compiled a list of humanist slab serifs, the category into I would put Soho except that I see it as more cold and mechanical (“modern”?). Here goes (all fonts available on MyFonts.com unless otherwise listed):

Silica (Stonetypefoundry.com)  
PMN Caecilia  
Enclave (Terminaldesign.com)  
Chaparral  
TheSerif (Lucasfonts.com)  
ITC Officina Serif  
Amasis  
FF Olsen  
Placebo Serif  
Aptifer Slab

EDIT: And how could I have forgotten Stag from Vllg.com?

How do you try out Stag? Nevermind found it

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

Is there one that contains a hint of Quint like serifs? Amasis is very close.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_  
I know I am in my own little world, but its ok. They know me here

FF Page Serif  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/page-serif/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014010915/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/page-serif/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/page-serif/")

FF Zine Slab or Serif  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=zine&site=d&btnG=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014010915/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=zine&site=d&btnG=Go "http://www.fontshop.com/search/?q=zine&site=d&btnG=Go")
